duties_responsibilities.duty: Carrying out maintenance processes of the property, including corrective, preventative, routine, emergency, and cosmetic maintenance.
Assisting in the make-ready process in a manner consistent with the property’s operational objectives under the supervision of the Service Supervisor and Community Manager.
Responding to resident/management requests and work orders for community common areas, buildings, and units in a timely manner.
Inspecting grounds, buildings, and other community features daily to identify, minimize and correct hazardous property conditions or liability concerns.
Maintaining preventative maintenance program that extends the life of the community while minimizing future repairs.
Assisting with the general upkeep, maintenance, and cleaning of office, common areas, and model unit.
Enforcing policies of the community that the immediate supervisor delegates.
Utilizing property resources, equipment, and supplies economically.
Performing additional tasks and responsibilities requested by Maintenance Supervisor and Community Manager.
Participating in on-call emergency at the community.
Managing excellent customer service and monitoring service request turnaround and responsiveness.
Projecting a favorable image of the community to achieve property objectives and public recognition.
Ensuring consistency in dealing with residents on all matters.
Reporting any observed violations of community rules and regulations to the Maintenance Supervisor and/or Community Manager.
Participating in unit inspections as requested.
Maintaining the hazard communications program; teaching and promoting safe work practices.
Maintaining accurate records regarding service requests, EPA/OSHA standards, preventative maintenance, apartment make-ready status, work in progress, etc.

education_certification.credential: High School Diploma or equivalent (Trade School certification preferred)
